titles.title: Religious FIRE Act
Religious Freedom International Reciprocity Enhancement Act

To provide that it shall be unlawful for foreign nationals of a country that limits the free exercise of religion in that country to make any expenditure in the United States to promote a religion in the United States, and for other purposes.
Religious FIRE Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary:
Religious Freedom International Reciprocity Enhancement Act or the Religious FIRE Act
This bill prohibits a foreign national of a country that limits the free exercise of religion in that country from making any expenditure in the United States promoting a religion.
An asset consisting of such an expenditure or the proceeds of such an expenditure is subject to U.S. forfeiture.
